channel.title: Back with some free time available
channel.description:
Thought I'd post here instead of hijacking an existing thread. So after a few months of inactivity I have some spare time available. I am mainly involved in the following projects: * Whonix Live Desktop Installer * XFCE theming
@Patrick how best should I proceed? Pull requests on github? More testing? Taking open tickets? I thought I could start with XFCE theming, the easiest part. Should I make pull requests on github?

item.title: Back with some free time available
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
onion_knight via Whonix Forum:

Thought I’d post here instead of hijacking an existing thread. So
after a few months of inactivity I have some spare time available. I
am mainly involved in the following projects: * Whonix Live Desktop
Installer * XFCE theming

Great!

Pull requests on github?

That would be excellent. (Btw no adamancy about pull requests / github.
Just usual process but not mandatory. Git branches anywhere would work
to. Decision of taste.)

testing?

Not sure what needs testing currently.

Taking open tickets?

Even more excellent (results in pull requests too).

I thought I could start with XFCE
theming, the easiest part.

Sounds great!

Yeah. Indeed. What’s missing most is source code / pull requests.

Read full topic
item.source: Back with some free time available
